--- layout: component title: Forms description: Forms are a grouping of data input fields and controls into which the user can enter data. Forms can be used for a variety of cases, but the one constant is that they require the user to enter input and then submit it to the system for processing. Forms can appear on their own or inside another component, like a sidebar or modal. Forms should follow a logical flow based upon the task at hand and the kind of information required to complete it. guidelines: do: - Organize forms in one column - Group related information (e.g. personal, account, contact) - Align labels with the top of controls - Use appropriate type attribute (e.g. email, tel, number) to enable mobile-friendly input (reference) - Add the .optional class to a control's label when it is not required dont: - Use form controls outside of a form (e.g. checkbox, radio button, input field) - Use placeholder text as labels - Make labels ALL-CAPS contents: - Usage guidelines - Basic form - Input field - Checkbox - Radio button - Toggle - Select menu - Textarea - Error message - Alternate error markup ---
